org.team4159.boths.template

Class Template

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.team4159.boths.template.Template

  • public class Template
extends java.lang.Object
    The Template class represents an HTML template page. The syntax for specifying variables is loosely based off of Django's templating system. However, at the current moment, only variables are supported; tags and filters are not yet supported.

    If text in the form of {{var}} appears in the template source, they will be replaced by context variables passed to the render() method.

    Note that because this template is designed to render HTML, all variables will automatically be escaped (< becomes &lt;, > becomes &gt;, etc.). To avoid automatic escaping, add an exclamation point (!) after the variable name: {{var!}}

    See Also:
    Django Website

      • load

        public static Template load(java.lang.Class cls,
            java.lang.String filename)
        Loads a template from the specified filename, relative to the package in which the given class is located. If the filename starts with "/", locate the template file relative to the root package. In other words, if the template is located in index.html in your resources directory, the filename should be "index.html".
        Parameters:
        cls - A class in the package in which the template file will be located.
        filename - The path to the template file.
        Returns:
        A newly-created Template object.
        Throws:
        TemplateException - if the template file is not found or failed to load.
        ParseException - if parsing failed
